MultipleChoice.D: the lettuce will wilt and die

FirstYear1stSemSyllabus.Subject_Code: 1. Which of the following statements is definitely true about the nature of science?

MultipleChoice.A: Science will help make the world a better place to live in.
MultipleChoice.B: Science can always uncover the truth in the realm of nature.
MultipleChoice.C: Scientific work requires a dedication that excludes the lives of people in other fields of work
MultipleChoice.D: Theories in science can be disproved by testing: a well established theory can be demolished with a single observation.

3. Which of the following statements best describes the connection between science and technology?

MultipleChoice.A: Scientist use the laws and principles discovered by technologists.
MultipleChoice.B: Technology is the part of science that deals with mechanical problems.
MultipleChoice.C: Technology involves the practical applications of scientific knowledge.
MultipleChoice.D: Science depends on technology for ideas and the organization of experimental work.

MultipleChoice.A: Tungsten has a high melting point
MultipleChoice.B: Metals are good conductors of heat.
MultipleChoice.C: Resistance is inversely proportional to current.
MultipleChoice.D: Fluorescent lamps are improved through methods of manufacturing.
